result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle N Panek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs due during period of supervision.
Pay supervision fees.
  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment

Submit to DNA sample.
Court is recommending defendant undergo Rogers Memorial 90 Day In-patient Program upon completion of condition time.

Restitution due during period of supervision.
The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

superMiscConds.notes:
Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.

No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia.

supervisions.notes: Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Dept of Corrections to collect from defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account, an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle N Panek

11:00 AM Defendant Kyle N Panek in court with attorney Heather Dvoran.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State has no additions or corrections to the Memorandum.  Counsel has no additions or corrections to the Memorandum.  State makes recommendation as to sentencing.  Counsel as to sentencing.  State has complied with Victim's rights.  Statements by Defendant.  Court renders judgment.
Controller confirmed balance due with DOC Cashier. Defendant has paid restitution and partial costs through probation, owes $295.00 costs/surcharges.

State by ADA Patti Wabitsch.  Defendant in custody & appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty Alme Boaz.  Counsel advises the defendant does qualify for public defender representation.  Court finds probable cause.  Counsel waives reading of the complaint.  Counsel advises the address is correct on the complaint, however, also provides a mailing address.  State requesting $25,000 cash bail.  Court orders $25,000 cash bail w/conditions:  no contact with PDQ Convenience Store in Cedarburg WI.  Counsel requesting preliminary hearing; not waiving timelimits.  Court orders matter adj to 2/10 at 11 am for preliminary hearing.
